abstract: Shares of companies with weak balance sheets have been soaring, but the extreme outperformance of more speculative stocks could make them vulnerable.
snippet: Shares of companies with weak balance sheets have been soaring, but the extreme outperformance of more speculative stocks could make them vulnerable.
lead_paragraph: SANMINA-SCI, the supplier of electronics services, is loaded with debt and in each of the last eightyears has lost money. Its shares have risen more than 600 percent since the stock market rally began on March 9.

headline.main: When the Performance Looks a Little Too Good
headline.print_headline: When the Performance Looks a Little Too Good
